hackathon-description-text: Join us for a 24-hour software development marathon as you compete (solo or with your #squad) to build crazy-cool projects using Twitch’s developer toolset. Twitch developers will be hanging out through the whole event, answering your questions about life at Twitch and helping you along with your apps, extensions, chat bots - whatever you can come up with!
hackathon-requirements: Projects must incorporate at least one developer product listed on
hackathon-rules:
Teams may be of no more than four people and can be formed before or at the start of the event.
Each participant may only work on one project.
A project may not have any code dedicated to it until hacking begins on the Friday of the event. Setting up your development environment with SDKs in advance is fine.
Projects must be submitted by the time hacking ends on the Saturday of the event. After that, presentation materials may be worked on but no more design/development can be done on the submission.
Submissions will be judged on creativity, utility, presentation, and that special “Twitch” factor.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $500 gift card to each member of the winning team!
$200 gift card to each member of the winning team!
$150 gift card to each member of the winning team!
$150 gift card to each member of the winning team!

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=300 E Ocean Blvd, Long Beach, CA 90802, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Does this project tackle a problem in a new and interesting way?
How useful would this project be to use?
Is this project presented in a way that promotes use?
How well does this project fit with Twitch's culture?

hackathon-location-address: 300 E Ocean Blvd, Long Beach, CA 90802, USA
hackathon-description-header: Use Twitch's suite of developer product to build the (chat bot, data viz, extension, etc) of your dreams!
